title: Data Analyst
description:
Over Merkle Nederland

Merkle is een toonaangevend Customer Experience Management (CXM) bureau en gespecialiseerd in het leveren van unieke, gepersonaliseerde klantervaringen over platformen en apparaten heen. Altijd gedreven door data, ondersteund door technologie, bewezen door prestaties en gevoed door creativiteit. Merkle heeft ruim 13.000 medewerkers en 50 vestigingen over de gehele wereld en is onderdeel van dentsu. In Amsterdam en Rotterdam werken meer dan 285 mensen voor toonaangevende klanten zoals Microsoft, T-Mobile, ASML, HEMA, Marktplaats, VodafoneZiggo, NS en Signify. Het bedrijf is strategisch partner van o.a. Google, Adobe, Salesforce, Bol.com en Selligent.

Zit het ontwerpen en optimaliseren van marketingprocessen en campagnes in jouw bloed? Dan is dit de vacature die jij zoekt!

Ben jij …

…een Business Analyst die graag uitdagingen aangaat en enthousiast wordt van complexe marketing en data vraagstukken? Vat je de wensen van opdrachtgevers het liefst samen in helder omschreven requirements en ben je op je best wanneer je deze kunt uitwerken tot een duidelijk ontwerp? Dan ben jij de persoon die wij zoeken!

Dit ga je doen…

Als Business Analyst maak je deel uit van een van de Marketing Technology  teams binnen Merkle. Deze teams houden zich bezig met het implementeren van marketing technology zoals Selligent Marketing Cloud, Salesforce, Adobe of Google. Jij bent verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen en optimaliseren van uiteenlopende marketingprocessen en -campagnes voor onze opdrachtgevers. Je zet conceptuele datamodellen op en maakt specificaties voor (realtime) interfaces tussen onze marketing technology tooling en diverse externe partijen. Denk daarbij aan Google Ads, Facebook, selfcare omgevingen van de klant of fulfillment partijen zoals callcenters of printhuizen. Dit alles doe je op een manier die aansluit bij de belevingswereld van zowel de klant (veelal marketeers of productowners) als de campagne en data engineers die jouw ontwerp implementeren.

Je werkt nauw samen met technische experts, consultants, marketeers, andere informatie analisten en soms data analisten op innovatie of managed services projecten binnen en buiten Merkle. De teams adviseren interne en externe opdrachtgevers, zodat zij hun marketingactiviteiten verder kunnen optimaliseren en de vraagstukken zijn breed, maar daar word jij juist blij van toch?

Je hebt minstens twee jaar werkervaring of aantoonbare affiniteit met het beschrijven (en valideren) van requirements, in een vorm die het best aansluit bij de klant en/of het systeem dat gemaakt moet worden. Het uitwerken van ETL processen is ook bij veel projecten een belangrijk onderdeel van het werk. Daarnaast heb je kennis van en ervaring met relationele databases, realtime interfaces, customer intelligence en beschik je over basiskennis in programmeren. Kennis van marketingdata vraagstukken of bureau ervaring is een vette pre. Ook beschik je over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, ben je proactief en oplossingsgericht. Je weet collega’s en klanten mee te nemen in oplossingen en proposities van het team. Last but not least, word je zichtbaar gedreven door het vak, ben je bevlogen, nieuwsgierig en een aanpakker, we zijn nu eenmaal een agency .

Bij Merkle werk je samen met hoogopgeleide collega’s en iedere dag word je uitgedaagd om je verder te verdiepen in de ons vakgebied en het uiterste te halen uit jezelf. We bieden je een baan waarin je al je kennis en talenten optimaal kunt benutten en voor mooie klanten werkt zoals Goede Doelen Loterijen, Stern automotive, , NS, T-Mobile, Praxis of Tesco Mobile. Dit wil jij toch ook?

Daarnaast heb je:

  • Een afgeronde hbo/wo studie zoals bijvoorbeeld Business Information Management, of een verwante opleiding met een analytisch kader;
  • Kennis van of ervaring met het vertalen van inzichten naar concrete acties, regelmatig vervul je de rol van product owner by proxy; 
  • Ervaring met het beschrijven en valideren van requirements,  usecases, userstories of met business analyse methodieken;
  • Ervaring met het maken van functionele specificaties (functioneel ontwerpen, interface beschrijvingen, proces modulering, data modulering);
  • Kennis van of ervaring met relationele databases zoals bijvoorbeeld SQL Server, Oracle, mySQL;
  • Begrip van de programmeertalen waarin je ontwerpen gebouwd worden, zoals SQL, R, Python of Java; ervaring is een pre;
  • Kennis van of ervaring met dashboard technologie zoals Qlik Sense, Tableau of Power BI is een pre;
  • Passie voor het analyseren van klantvragen en het ontwikkelen van datagedreven oplossingen;
  • Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal vinden we belangrijk.

Als je geïnteresseerd bent, maar je herkent je niet volledig in iedere specificatie, laat dat dan je niet afschrikken. Het is bovenal een wishlist.

Wat wij bieden...

Best veel, maar hier wat highlights:

  • Een uitdagende functie met veel aandacht voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling;
  • Een goed salaris met prima secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden;
  • Een uitdagende omgeving met diverse opdrachtgevers. Van groot tot klein. Zo raak je in relatief weinig tijd bekend met veel verschillende branches, tools en methodieken;
  • Een plek in een team met ambitieuze, resultaat gedreven en gezellige collega's bij een innovatief bedrijf;
  • Voldoende ruimte voor andere toffe dingen naast je werk zoals de digitale vrijdagmiddag borrel, onze stay active & healthy bootcamp en de office olympics;
  • Een internationale werkomgeving. Sparren met collega’s over de hele wereld!

Waar ga je werken?

Bij ons vind je een groep professionals met allemaal verschillende achtergronden en specialisaties. Specialisten die graag over de grenzen van hun vakgebied heen kijken en samen het ‘onmogelijke’ mogelijk willen maken voor onze klanten. We geven je veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. We houden niet van ellebogenwerk, wel van gezelligheid. Zelf vinden we de feestjes, de ruimte voor eigen initiatieven en de fijne sfeer ook echt top.

'Bij Merkle NL streven we naar een veilige werkplek met als doel gelijke kansen en behandeling voor iedereen. Waar iedereen zich welkom en veilig voelt om te zijn wie ze zijn en waar iedereen zich kan uiten. Omdat we voorstander zijn van echte verandering, moedigen we sollicitaties aan van kandidaten met verschillende achtergronden om zo onze diversiteit verder te vergroten.'

title: Full-time Full Stack Developer (Med/Sr)
description:
Hone your technical strengths with a global leader in the Automation Industry

Do you love being a Jack of all trades, helping out with numerous stages of development? Would you like to help a talented team develop software for a company that makes some of the most recognised solutions in its market, including cybersecurity?

If so, this may be the perfect role for you.

Let’s be clear. We’re not looking for the perfect candidate we don’t believe in unicorns (actually we do a bit!). What we need is a Full Stack Developer who wants to advance their craft. Someone who’s eager to learn and introduce innovative technologies.

Sure, we want you to have some relevant experience, so you should have a qualification in Computer Science or comparable plus knowledge of C++11 and Angular. A few years of work experience in web development would be great, too. We’d also be happy if you’re familiar with GIT, Linux, Scrum, test-driven development and continuous integration, and software architecture. 

So, what does the job involve? You’ll be developing and expanding both the server side and the client side of our applications. You’ll also be writing clean code, testing and debugging software, and designing and optimizing user interactions. You’d be an active member of the Scrum team, helping the R&D department design new features and keep pace with technological advances.

Sure, we want you to have some relevant experience, so you should have a qualification in Computer Science or comparable plus knowledge of C++11 and Angular. A few years of work experience in web development would be great, too. Oh, and you need to be fluent in English since we’re a global business.

  • work with precision and attention to detail and are happy to be part of a team;
  • can apply critical and analytical thinking to bugs and the improvement of processes; 
  • are willing to think outside the box and come up with creative solutions;
  • speak and write the language of technical and commercial stakeholders;

At Procentec we work with a driven, close and helpful team. We are empathetic, genuinely interested and passionate about everything we do. Working at Procentec means working in a team of professionals where personal development, personal responsibilities and collegiality are central. title: Deputy Care Manager
description:
We at Home Instead Senior Care – Greenwich & Bexley are proud to be the first and only homecare provider in Greenwich and Bexley boroughs to have received the highest rating of ‘Outstanding’ by CQC! 

We provide a variety of homecare services which include companionship, home help, personal care, Live In Care and specialised care. The care plans are highly personalised and tailored to the needs and wishes of our Clients. Continuity of care and building relationships is important to us, therefore, our visits last a minimum of 1 hour to 24/7 and we match our Clients with the right CAREGivers. Each CAREGiver will be introduced and have shadow shifts to ensure they feel fully confident before working independently.

Home Instead Senior Care - Greenwich and Bexley was established in 2015 and our mission is to brighten the lives of seniors giving them a sense of purpose, wellbeing & worth. This role will play a vital part ensuring that our clients receive the best in class quality care and support the growth of our business.

The Deputy Care Manager is expected to perform a variety of duties to assist the Registered Care Manager in ensuring compliance with the Essential Standards of Quality and Safety and adherence to The Health and Social Care Act 2008 (Regulated Activities) Regulations 2014, and to provide the highest quality of support to clients and CAREGivers.

Primary Responsiblity 

  • Deputise for the Registered Care Manager as and when required.
  • Provide motivational leadership and line management to the Client Services team, building and maintaining a positive team ethos.
  • Actively participate and contribute in objective setting and review succession planning
  • Undertake Key Players One-to-One Performance Reviews
  • Respond to new service enquiries received by phone, email, website and in person from prospective clients in a professional, knowledgeable and efficient way.
  • Undertake consultation to new clients, complete assessments and complete all new client’s paperwork as required.
  • Create new care plans, ensuring they are completed, reviewed and updated in accordance with Home Instead standards and update the computer system.
  • Ensure clients and CAREGivers are matched and CAREGiver schedules are coordinated effectively, using recurring scheduling, through Home Instead’s computer system.
  • Undertake all existing clients’ service review, update the care plans and complete all paperwork as required and update the computer system
  • Enter and maintain accurate client and CAREGiver records on the system and through hard copy files.
  • Carry out CAREGiver introductions to clients and shadow (lead if required) initial calls until the CAREGivers are settled onto the package.
  • Maintain regular touch points with Clients by carrying out courtesy calls, QA, Service Review as per Home Instead Franchise Standards, including maintaining and updating the computerised tracking system, ensuring that issues arising are dealt with/followed up on in a timely way.
  • Communicate regularly with clients, ensuring means of communication are tailored to individual client needs.
  • Ensure that client’s birthday cards and greeting cards are sent.
  • Carry out CAREGiver Appraisals, One-to-One Supervision, Return to Work meetings, Support Visits (Spot Checks), competency assessment and singing-off on Care Certificate.
  • Develop and maintain positive relationships with both clients and CAREGivers.
  • Ensure affective monitoring of service visits using the system.
  • Carry out Clients and CAREGivers satisfaction surveys and Reviews, for eg PEAQ survey, homecare.co.uk surveys.
  • Complete clients and CAREgivers termination process.
  • Perform regular Audit of the Clients and CAREGivers files and complete actions
  • Identify training & development needs for CAREGiver and Key Player & action
  • Support and develop team members through coaching, supervisions and appraisals, and deal with HR matters in accordance with policies and procedures.
  • Deal with safeguarding concerns following policies and procedures at all times. 
  • Participate in the out of hours “on call” rota.
  • Act as an ambassador for Home Instead Senior Care, demonstrating the values and culture at all times and being a positive role model to all staff.
  • Ensure the requirements of the CQC and the Franchise Standards (including all relevant policies and procedures) are met at all times.


Secondary responsibilities

  • Work outside of normal working hours when business needs require it
  • Provide hands-on care for clients as and when necessary
  • Support Care Coordinator with scheduling as and when needed.
  • Deliver Home Instead Learning & Development and other trainings.
  • Undertake networking activities and take part in networking events.
  • Participate in training, meetings as required.
  • Produce regular KPI reports for the Registered Care Manager/Director.
  • At all times maintain confidentiality for all Home Instead Information, including but not limited to client, Caregiver & office data.
  • Any other reasonable request by the management team.

Required Core Skills

  • Planning & Prioritisation
  • Safeguarding our people/clients
  • Problem Solving
  • Regulated Compliance
  • Management of Performance
  • Written & Verbal Communication
  • Using Business Policy & Process

Required Core Behaviours

  • Putting Clients first
  • Working Together
  • Achieving More
  • Having a Positive Impact & Influence
  • Knowing & Managing Self
  • Developing Self & Others
  • Seeks to Understand

Benefits 

  • Salary - £27,000 per annum
  • Oncall payment, as per our oncall payrate
  • Holiday pay and pension scheme
  • Discounts on your favourite brands including Tesco, Costa, Cineworld and many more!
  • Free membership to ‘Life and Progress Employee Assistance Programme’ which gives you 24/7 access to one to one counselling, legal advice and support, self-help and well being information
  • City and Guilds accredited training, Care Certificate, Dementia and End of Life trainings
  • Leadership and Management training
  • Staff social events

If you have a passion for caring and the motivation to help us achieve our ambitions, we would love to hear from you.

We encourage applications from all sections of the community as we want to reflect the neighbourhoods in which we work. Home Instead Senior Care is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of adults and expects all staff to share this commitment. This role is subject to DBS enhanced disclosure.

title: Privacy Impact Assessment Specialist
description:
As one of the largest independent technology companies in Atlantic Canada, Mariner has a team of over 200 IT and software professionals working with clients both regionally and across the globe. With extensive capabilities in the areas of analytics, automation software, information security and IT consulting, Mariner has been delivering innovative solutions with a strong emphasis on productivity and customer experience since 2003.

Mariner is actively looking for a Privacy and Policy Analyst to join their team.  The successful candidate will be responsible to research, analyze, identify risks and required action, develop/update Policy, assist with developing MOU/MOA as required and complete PIA services for Digital Platform Services.

Must-haves

Experienced in privacy legislation including Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (FIPPA), Personal Health Information Protection Act (PHIPA), the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA)

Privacy impact assessments involving personal health information

Nice to have

Public sector experience

HealthCare sector

Role Description

Required to lead or support the development of a privacy impact assessment that evaluates whether new technologies, information systems, or proposed programs or policies meet legal and policy privacy requirements, determine and mitigate risks, and address clients’ concerns.

These requirements include ensuring that the program complies with provincial, municipal, federal and private sector access and privacy legislation, as well as relevant regulations, statutes, Directives, standards, guidelines and internationally accepted Fair Information Practices.

General Skills:

  • Excellent knowledge of privacy and security concepts, trends, and issues. This will include an understanding of their impact on business processes, as well as skill with interpretation and communication of principles and compliance requirements.
  • Knowledge of, and experience in researching and applying relevant information privacy laws, regulations, jurisprudence (particularly as it relates to the Information and Privacy Commissioner of Ontario) and risk countermeasures.
  • Experience in conducting Privacy Impact Assessments in public sector context.
  • Knowledge of, and experience with privacy enhancing best practices.
  • Knowledge and ability to interpret and apply the province’s Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (FIPPA) and its municipal equivalent the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (MFIPPA), Personal Health Information Protection Act (PHIPA) their respective regulations and related jurisprudence.
  • Familiarity with federal Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA) and US PATRIOT Act.

Policy Knowledge:

  • Familiarity with Privacy Impact Assessment Process and Tools
  • Good understanding of related disciplines, such as IT security, IT system design, policy development (privacy or security), business architecture, legal processes, Freedom of Information administration, business analysis, risk management, project management.

Operational Program and Business Design Skills:

  • Ability to lead, mange or support the development of a PIA either independently or as part of a team by directing and gathering input from specific individuals within the organization.
  • Knowledge and ability to create and understand data flow diagrams and business process diagrams.
  • Ability to recognize the need for, and seek input from external experts as required.
  • Conduct PIAs as required.
  • Develop privacy-enhancing tools and techniques.
  • Develop KPIs and report metrics.
  • Develop ways and means to align with broader government programs and practices.
  • Develop designs and architectures to inform a ‘privacy/data governance function’ for the DI Program and potentially all of ODS.
  • Provide privacy and data governance advisory services.
  • Assist with development of statutory and regulatory instruments to address digital identity and related privacy matters.
  • Excellent communication skills with technical and business audiences and non- access and privacy experts.

Technology and Systems Knowledge:

  • Analytical skills to understand the current and future access and privacy implications of policies, decisions and business initiatives.
  • Knowledge of Information Technology concepts and processes that impact the protection of personal information, including (but not limited to) Internet tools, system interfaces, information security, information architecture and data flows.

Information and Record Keeping Knowledge:

  • Experience in developing risk assessment tools, methodologies, policies and procedures to effectively manage personal information.
  • Knowledge of policies, directives, standards, business rules, procedures and guidelines relating to records management including classification, retention and disposition of information.

Desirable Skills:

  • Professional certification from a related discipline such as IT security, architecture.
  • Experience providing education and training related to privacy.
  • Knowledge of, and experience with the policies and procedures of the government (e.g. business case development, project approvals and policy development).

Experience and Skill Set Requirements

35% - Privacy Assessment Experience, Policy and Legislative Requirements

  • Experienced in privacy legislation including Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (FIPPA), Personal Health Information Protection Act (PHIPA), the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA)
  • Experienced in conducting privacy assessments involving personal health information, citing examples in resume.
  • Experienced in leading and conducting privacy assessments with Ontario based hospitals, involving online and/or mobile digital solutions that handle personal and health related information,
  • Lead and conducted assessments involving personal health information involving third party solutions (e.g private sector or non-profit application solutions) and/or service integration providers
  • Experienced working with legal council and/or policy development teams; reviewing and comparing policies and legislation to make informed recommendations to ensure adequate legal and/or statutory authorities, privacy protections and record keeping considerations are addressed in support of program and project specific objectives.

30% - Technical understanding

  • Experience with privacy risks and conducting PIAs associated with integration between legacy systems, web applications, mobile and cloud based solutions to obtain, retrieve and synchronize information.
  • Experience with privacy risks and conducting PIAs involving mobile app solutions and the unique security and privacy challenges associated with such platforms
  • Demonstrated experience and familiarity with strong security, encryption and privacy protection approaches to digital solutions, including mobile; web based and backend integrations via API or similar approaches.
  • Familiar with Digital Wallet technologies (native within OS or third party) including the security and privacy considerations, limitations and best practices for local data protection on mobile devices
  • Familiar with cloud based digital wallet technologies including the security and privacy considerations, limitations and best practices for data protection
  • Experience, knowledge and understanding of privacy protection standards and best practices, business, information and security architecture principles and emerging technology related to the protection of privacy and personal information

30% - Leadership and Communications

  • Demonstrated strong communication and engagement skills with ability to lead teams in discovery sessions to elicit details of technical solutions, business processes and/or policies; strong writing skills to document findings, recommendation, etc
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret both technical (e.g architecture design documents, process flows, state transition diagrams, etc) and non technical documentation to conduct assessment of impacts and to develop mitigation strategies
  • Strong organizational and time management skills to manage multiple and concurrent requests in an agile and highly dynamic work environment setting.
  • Strong presentation abilities to communicate findings, recommendations, etc to senior management and executives to inform decision making; able to communicate complex problems/issues in a simple terms

description:

Aktivno smo uključeni u rast i razvoj lokalne IT i akademske zajednice. Među pokretačima smo udruge Osijek Software City i inicijatorima izgradnje IT parka Osijek i uselili smo u trenutačno najmoderniju poslovnu zgradu toga tipa. Imamo vlastiti stipendijski program za studente. A našem uspjehu svjedoče brojne domaće i međunarodne nagrade...
Za sve su zaslužni naši ljudi, rastući tim od 120+ developera, business analysta, project managera, dizajnera i testera - u kojemu bismo voljeli vidjeti i tebe, ako se pronalaziš u ovim rečenicama.

Mono studentska praksa i stipendija FAQ

- Tko se može prijaviti?
Za Mono stručnu praksu i stipendiju mogu se prijaviti isključivo studenti računarstva i srodnih područja: Odjela za matematiku i FERIT-a Sveučilišta u Osijeku te sličnih fakulteta i studijskih programa izvan Osijeka.

- Zašto baš Mono?
Kroz našu praksu steći ćeš konkretna znanja potrebna za početak rada u struci. Još važnije, imat ćeš priliku učiti od iskusnih i vrhunskih stručnjaka u stabilnoj tvrtki koja kontinuirano raste, niže priznanja te brine o svojim zaposlenicima.

- Koliko traje Mono praksa?
Mono praksa u pravilu traje oko pet tjedana, odnosno 200 sati. 

- Odvija li se Mono praksa online ili uživo?
Inače se Mono praksa u pravilu odvijala u našim uredima, međutim, od početka 2020. godine praksa se realizira u potpunosti remote (online), putem Slacka. Uživo ćemo se vidjeti kada ti budemo uručili diplomu, a ako se istakneš, možda ti već tada ponudimo i posao. :)

- Što ću naučiti na praksi u Monu?
U sklopu Mono prakse steći ćeš i tehničke vještine i soft skilove. Konkretno ćeš na praksi raditi u timu i na stvarnome projektu. Naučit ćeš razvijati web aplikacije u C# i .NET frameworku (BE) te u JavaScriptu u React frameworku (FE); naučit ćeš raditi s Gitom, bazama podataka (SQL, PostgreSQL), naučit ćeš osnove HTTP protokola, ali i kako popraviti pogreške i dogovarati nove značajke. Uz sve navedeno, kod nas ćeš naučiti i osnove project managementa.

- Imam li šansu za zaposlenjem nakon prakse/stipendije?
Da. Ako praksu uspješno završiš i pokažeš nam da te jednostavno moramo zadržati u našem timu, ponudit ćemo ti posao na poziciji Junior web developera (preko studentskog ugovora). Kod nas ćeš imati priliku nastaviti razvijati vještine i stjecati nova znanja o osnovnim i naprednim tehnologijama (AI, machine learning, deep learning...).

- Kako se postaje Mono stipendist?
Sve dodatne informacije o stipendiji potraži u ovom postu: https://www.mono.hr/2021/09/08/Mono-stipendija-2021/.

Od tebe očekujemo iskustvo u programiranju, osnovno poznavanje web tehnologija i općenito želju za učenjem i usavršavanjem u području novih tehnologija.

Što Mono nudi svojim zaposlenicima?

- osobni i profesionalni razvoj: rad na izazovnim i uzbudljivim in-house i klijentskim projektima baziranima na najmodernijim tehnologijama, u dinamičnom okruženju i poticajnoj radnoj atmosferi uz mogućnost djelomičnog rada remote
- mentorstvo: na svakom početku dobro je imati nekoga tko ti može pomoći i voditi te kroz nove izazove; zato u Monu imamo iskusne i stručne mentore, interne radionice i izazove koji pomažu u jačanju znanja i samopouzdanja
- edukacije & team buildinge: organiziramo team buildinge, odlaske na konferencije i edukacije te angažman u zajednici (Osijek Software City, DIO, Digital Design Academy, KulenDayz, CodeCAMP...)
- konkretna primanja & napredovanje: tražimo iznadprosječne pojedince pa su benefiti u vidu plaća i bonusa, uređaja i softvera, stručnih edukacija, te ulaganja u profesionalni razvoj i ostaloga, također iznadprosječni, motivirajući i primjereni rezultatima rada
- Tim s velikim T: radimo žestoko, ali se i dobro zabavljamo - njegujemo opuštenu atmosferu s minimumom hijerarhije i dobrom energijom u uredu

mono.hr i mono.software.

description:
Ubisoft Düsseldorf is home to nearly 500 people, making up several teams dedicated to delivering AAA excellence and innovation across a wide portfolio of games and technologies. 

As part of Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora, you will play an instrumental role in bringing to life the beautiful and dangerous world of Pandora. This is an opportunity for you to keep growing your experience in games while working hand in hand with Disney’s creative minds and James Cameron's production company, Lightstorm Entertainment.

As our new Senior Animator, you will drive the animation quality of a brand-new IP and collaborate with Directors to deliver an amazing AAA game experience.

  • Animate and motion edit Mocap data within complex animation systems
  • Collaborate with the Art Director and Lead Animator to create animations that fit to the visual style of the project

  • Provide skinning for complex characters

  • Fluent in English, both verbally and written

We offer the opportunity to work on a brand-new IP from Ubisoft, where you will get the chance to really put your own mark on the game!

You get the opportunity to create unique animations in our snowdrop engine, with the goal of bringing life to the beautiful and dangerous world of Pandora.

As a specialist vehicle finance provider, we understand that a reliable car, van, or motorbike is more than just a vehicle. We have a passion for getting our customers where they want to be. It’s this approach that has won us multiple awards, which most recently includes, Sub-Prime Lender of the Year’ and ‘Independent Finance Provider of the Year’ at the Motor Finance Europe Awards 2021, ‘Specialist Lender of the Year’ and ‘Vehicle Finance Provider of the Year’ at the National Credit Awards 2021, and the Feefo Platinum Award 2021.

What’s the Opportunity?

Join our busy Credit Risk team as a Senior Credit Risk Analyst and take responsibility for developing, maintaining and reporting on effective new business acquisition strategies. This will include covering areas such as Credit Risk scorecards, policy rules, fraud prevention strategies and affordability models.

You’ve got the option to work from the comfort of your own home or from our friendly office in Petersfield, however the team do aim to get together once a month so some travel to the office will be required.

Key responsibilities of a Senior Credit Risk Analyst

  • Assist Credit Risk Manager in the development, management and monitoring of all models including acquisition and behavioural scorecards, cut-off models and system policy rule sets.
  • Assist in the design, build, implementation and monitoring of affordability models and strategies in line with FCA requirements and prevailing legislation to ensure outcomes aligned to business and customer objectives
  • Undertake new business analysis and reporting which facilitates effective credit risk analysis and control, ensuring material trends are identified effectively and appropriately escalated to the CCO or Credit Committee
  • Lead deep-dive analytics (acquisition, portfolio, customer, affordability) and ad-hoc analysis to drive actionable insights and recommendations
  • Assist in the development of fraud prevention and detection strategies at the customer onboarding stage to protect and mitigate fraud loss

What will it take to be a successful Senior Credit Risk Analyst?

  • Experience of new business / acquisition analytics in a finance services context
  • Ability to use analytical and statistical tools (primarily SAS) on large, complex, multi-dimensional datasets
  • Ability to build positive working relationships with other business stakeholders, acting as an Subject Matter Expert on all credit risk aspects relating to new business / acquisition
  • Strong written presentation skills, with ability to translate complex analytical issues into non-technical delivery
  • Strong leadership skills

We’re passionate about our colleagues and invest in professional development, offer flexible working, and provide tools to look after our colleague’s wellbeing. Our colleague forums run regularly which allows everyone to have their say in an environment that offers no judgement. We’re also incredibly proud to have won the Company Culture Lotus Award for several years running.

We also believe this goes a long way to helping us live our purpose and defines why we’re here in the first place: to help put people on a path to a better everyday life.

title: Assistant Store Manager
description:
Welkom bij JYSK! Wij verkopen alles om van een huis een thuis te maken: meubels, matrassen/dekbedden/kussens en woonaccessoires. Scandinavisch design aan betaalbare prijzen met een fantastische klantenservice als kers op de taart.

Samen met de Store Manager ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het beheer van een JYSK winkel. Met z’n tweeën bepalen jullie wat nodig is om de targets te behalen en motiveren jullie het team om deze doelen te realiseren.

Daarnaast:

  • Ben jij verantwoordelijk voor de sales resultaten en zorg jij dat elke klant kan proeven van een fantastische klantenservice.
  • Garandeer jij een optimale winkeluitstraling en logistiek proces.
  • Stel je een commerciële planning op in functie van de klant- en goederenstroom

Wij bieden (naast de gewone verloning):

  • Een bonus per kwartaal die een hoge omzet en goede resultaten beloont
  • Praktijkgerichte opleidingen die jou nog beter maken in jouw vak!
  • Doorgroeimogelijkheden (Wij streven ernaar om 90% van onze leidinggevenden intern te benoemen)

 

Uiteraard krijg je als ambassadeur van ons merk 20% korting op JYSK producten!

Deze functie is jou helemaal op het lijf geschreven want jij...:  

  • Hebt idealiter al ervaring opgedaan in een leidinggevende rol of bent klaar om deze stap te zetten
  • Houdt ervan om samen met je collega’s de krachten te bundelen en zo van elke dag een succes te maken. Je haalt het beste uit jouw collega’s naar boven en motiveert hen om de beste resultaten te behalen
  • Bent gedreven en ambitieus: een eigen JYSK winkel leiden binnen 1 à 2 jaar? Daar zeg jij geen nee tegen.
  • Weet van aanpakken: Je kan knopen doorhakken en richting aangeven, ook in stressvolle situaties
  •  Bent niet gemaakt voor een bureau job: als leidinggevende ben je aanwezig op de winkelvloer “where the magic happens”. Bovendien wordt je niet afgeschrikt door fysiek zwaar werk
  • Geniet graag van een vrije dag tijdens de week zodat je op zaterdag paraat kan staan voor jouw team en onze klanten.

Misschien heb je (nog) niet van ons gehoord, maar miljoenen klanten over de hele wereld wel. In 1979 openden we de allereerste JYSK winkel in Denemarken, sindsdien hebben we onze deuren in meer dan 50 landen geopend met als resultaat meer dan 3.000 winkels wereldwijd.

In april 2017 openden we de eerste winkels in België en we hebben de ambitie om tot 100 winkels te openen, met een tempo van 10 winkelopeningen per jaar. 

JYSK. Dat is:

  • Alles op alles zetten om de omzetdoelen te behalen en van zodra het zover is een vreugdedansje doen in het midden van de winkel
  • Zwetend en zwoegend 50 paletten vracht verwerken maar toch de goede vibe erin houden zodat we op het einde van de dag fier kunnen zijn op een super georganiseerd magazijn
  • Niet te trots zijn om als Store Manager de winkel te stofzuigen terwijl je team zich volledig op de verkoop heeft gestort
  • Harde inzet, drive en resultaten belonen met een volgende stap: als logistiek verantwoordelijke starten en terecht komen in een functie als District Manager? Als Verkoopmedewerker doorgroeien tot Retail Manager? Voorbeelden genoeg!

Kortom: bij JYSK proberen we dagelijks verwachtingen te overtreffen: van onze klanten, van onze collega’s en van onze kandidaten. AT JYSK WE PLAY TO WIN!

description:

We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.

You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Organization Summary

Within Visa’s Technology organization, the Digital & Developer Platform (VDDP) team is a global division of over 1100 team members responsible for developing and managing end-to-end technology solutions that promote the growth of digital commerce and mobilization of payments in emerging and developed markets.  A globally distributed team, VDDP encompasses Product Development, Program Management, Portfolio & Business Management, Architecture, and Test Engineering, Client Integration, Release & Support Engineering functions.  

Essential Functions

  • Accountable for creating application and infrastructure performance plans/models for a highly scalable, low-latency, highly-available and high-throughput payment processing system
  • Work with the architects and development team to ensure proper metrics instrumentation done in software components, to help facilitate real time and remote troubleshooting/performance monitoring
  • Evaluate load test results to identify the bottleneck and provide suggestions and optimization input
  • Understand and performance test the APIs, abstractions and integration patterns to solve challenging distributed computing problems
  • Should have experience in defining Performance Strategy and reporting performance baselines required to certify Go-Lives. Should have strong experience in handling multiple tasks and stakeholders
  • Should be well versed in documenting the steps performed during course of performance tests cycle including performance test scripts used
  • Should be able to provide mentor support emphasizing performance testing methodology, preparation, scripting, execution planning, simulation and test results reporting
  • Should be able to able to look at the code and suggest optimization techniques
  • Should have ability to work independently and be a team player
  • Actively contribute to capacity planning and disaster recovery exercises
  • Support in triaging and troubleshooting of issues related to performance degradation incidents in production environment
  • Monitor application performance, optimize performance bottlenecks and usage to create an application capacity model
  • Help optimizing system components such as CPU/Memory/Disk/Network & OS/Application software for maximizing the computer resources utilization
  • Ensure all the deliverables assigned to the team are met with high quality
  • Manage day to day deliverables assign to the team members


• Expert knowledge in hardware, software, and distributed applications environments and solid understanding of their associated capacity and performance indicators
• Expert knowledge and strong experience using tools, Loadrunner/Jmeter,. etc. and understanding of APM solutions like Appdynamics, dynatrace, OPNET, etc.
• Hands on experience in Unix/Linux OS environments and operating system internals, file systems, disk/storage and networking protocols
• System internals. Having working knowledge with VMs and Containers
• Coding Knowledge in programming languages like Java/Python and scripting languages is must
• Experience in ORACLE/MYSQL DB tuning and optimization
• Knowledge of distributed database, distributed computing and high frequency transactions is a big plus
• Knowledge and understanding of MQ/Kafka system
• Working familiarity with the entire software development lifecycle including version control, build process, testing, and code release
• Effective verbal and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal, facilitation and leadership skills
• Deeply self-motivated with the ability to work independently, coordinating activities within cross-regional and multi-functional teams
• Previous experience with financial services or payments processing domain is a big plus
• Knowledge of any scripting language is a must

We're looking for UX-focused Content Design Interns to help plan and create interface content for Shopify products. We’re a team of 30 content strategists and our products are used by over 1.7 million merchants every day. Our merchants rely on Shopify to provide them with the tools they need to run their business. Content Designers work closely with UX researchers and Designers to create products that make commerce better for everyone. 

The UX team starts by identifying the right problems to solve for the highest impact, then performs research, prototype solutions, and ships features (sometimes all in the same week!). This isn't a content marketing or social media role. You'll work closely with the content design team to learn about and push this discipline forward, while working with a project team that includes UXers, developers, and engineers, to implement solutions that directly affect our merchants and prospective merchants.

Being an intern at Shopify means you get to be impactful, and build for the long term. You'll get to work alongside full-time content strategists on projects that become real features in our software and other digital properties. You can read about being a Content design intern at Shopify through these blog posts written by some of our past interns:

  • What you don’t learn in design school

  • Measuring up to personal growth

You can also browse  this collection of content strategy Medium articles by Shopifolk. 

The kind of work you’ll do:

  • UX writing: Help write clear, concise, usable content for our product interfaces, websites, and communications. Polaris will help you get started.

  • UX design: Collaborate with designers to brainstorm, plan, and build new features, and improve what we have today.

  • Information architecture: Help plan navigation systems, taxonomy and nomenclature, and information architecture across Shopify products, websites, and communications.

  • Research: Do both qualitative and quantitative research to help inform your content decisions.

Shopify internships are 3-month, 4-month, or 8-month paid terms, and are open to students, co-ops, recent graduates, and those in the early stage of their design careers. The summer internships will start in May or June* 2022.

* June's start date will be a 3 month term.

This posting will close on Wednesday, January 19th, 2022 at 11:59PM EST. Applications will be reviewed and interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis. Applications will not be accepted after the deadline.

The kind of person we’re looking for:

  • Loves words, but understands that content strategy is much more than just copy

  • Works with developers to understand technical constraints

  • Asks for feedback on your work early and often

  • Works on things outside your comfort zone

  • Thinks critically about personal growth goals, strengths, and weaknesses.

The types of background a content strategist might have:

  • Literature and humanities

  • Writing

  • User Experience (UX) design 

  • Communications

  • Linguistics

  • Graphic design

  • Industrial design

  • Web design and development

 Mandatory details for application below.

In your application:

1. Include your resume.

2. To showcase your skills and to help us get a better understanding of your knowledge, please submit the mandatory Shopify Content Design Intern Exercise, save your exercise to a public google drive, and attach it to the field titled "Shopify Technical Challenge Submission (link)". Challenge submission is mandatory in order to be considered.

3. We're always looking to see where passion and engagement shows itself in all aspects of your life. Please answer the questions outlined in the application to tell us more about yourself!

  • If you were to open a Shopify store, what would you sell and why (or tell us about your store if you have one!) (200 word limit)

  • Any last thoughts? (ie. proud accomplishments, cool ideas, a joke, etc.) (200 word limit)

At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team, so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying!

 

The Hiring Process:

1. Candidates that move beyond the initial application stage will be invited to a “Life Story” interview with a Recruiter on the Intern Program team. 

2. After the Life Story, successful candidates will be invited to a 60 minute technical interview with two (2) Shopify Content Designers. You will be informed in advance of the interview of what you need to bring. 

3. After the technical interview, successful candidates are placed on teams based on their interests, skills and experience - each placement is done individually and with significant consideration.

Application screening will be on a rolling basis, with Life Stories happening throughout February, technical interviews throughout February and March, and final hiring decisions made by or before late March.

title: .NET Full Stack Developer
description:

A trusted partner for major brands in Retail, Consumer Goods, Manufacturing, and Automotive, Accesa helps businesses embrace flexibility, adaptability and evolution within their digital journey, through a large spectrum of tailored IT services, leveraging mainstream, niche, as well as legacy technologies.   • Develop solution features following development best practices and bug fixing for our web app

Professional opportunities

In this role, you will interact with different stakeholders to understand the business context and support them in the digitalization process. You will participate in all aspects of the software development lifecycle.

You will have the opportunity to contribute with solutions to improve our customer’s technological ecosystem.

Community insights

The team is backed-up by a competence center that supports professional development according to the individual needs and the project context.

Nice to have

title: Digital Design Intern - Summer 2022 (Remote, US&Canada)
description:
Shopify is a leading global commerce company, providing trusted tools to start, grow, market, and manage a retail business of any size. Shopify makes commerce better for everyone with a platform and services that are engineered for reliability, while delivering a better shopping experience for consumers everywhere. Shopify powers millions of businesses in more than 175 countries and is trusted by brands such as Allbirds, Gymshark, PepsiCo, Staples, and many more.

Shopify is now permanently remote, and we’re working towards a future that is digital by design. That location you see above? Consider it merely an example of hundreds of potential locations across Canada and the United States where Shopify is hiring. Learn more here: https://www.shopify.com/careers/work-anywhere

If you are applying from outside the Shopify careers page, please apply through our careers page (https://internships.shopify.com/) to ensure you are completing all application components.

As an intern at Shopify, you will be fully integrated into your team. In addition, mentorship will be available as you join 7000+ people who are serious about personal growth and learning.

We value high trust and flexibility (it’s always been a part of our culture) and if you’re expecting to be told exactly what to do, Shopify may not be the place for you. We don’t claim to have all the answers, and that’s why we look for independent thinkers, collaborators, and people hungry to grow alongside their team. Find out more about our past interns experiences, watch our Intern Diaries video, and learn more about how we approach mentorship at Shopify. We were also selected as one of WayUp’s Top 100 Intern Employers!

The UX team untangles complex problems and designs experiences that improve the lives of millions of creators and ambitious entrepreneurs. We’re building experiences that will define the future of commerce. Our design team is made up of over 500 designers and researchers.

These entrepreneurs rely on Shopify to provide them with the tools they need to run their business. Creating beautiful products includes identifying the right problems, performing research, prototyping solutions, and shipping features (sometimes all in the same week). The Shopify design internship program is an opportunity to take ownership over projects and to collaborate with other creatives, UX researchers and engineers, on a multi-disciplinary team. We believe in testing, iteration, and in giving our employees the room to experiment and grow.

Our Shopify design team creates tools that give even the most inexperienced entrepreneur the best chance to succeed. At the same time, we design solutions that help some of the world’s leading businesses manage enormous complexity. Making commerce better for everyone is Shopify’s passion and one of our designers main objectives.   

We welcome design interns from all backgrounds, whether you’re a student leveling up or a professional transitioning from another industry. 

As a Design Intern at Shopify, you will:

  • Be an active part of every stage of the design process to improve our merchants’ experience: from idea to research, building, shipping, and launch. This includes participating in design sprints to define and explore merchant problems.

  • Help your team develop empathy for our merchants and advocate for our merchants’ needs. Data will be just one of the many tools you will use to help inform your work.

  • Be paired with a dedicated mentor and a team of highly skilled designers who are committed to supporting your success and growing your skills through consistent feedback.

  • Collaborate with different disciplines. You’ll get the chance to work closely with engineers, product managers, and front-end developers to help explore, build, and ship your designs.

  • Learn how to approach complex problems and design elegant solutions.

  • Improve how you communicate the design challenges and opportunities you encounter.

Shopify internships are 3-month, 4-month, or 8-month paid terms, and are open to students, co-ops, recent graduates, and those in the early stage of their engineering/development careers. The summer internships will start in May or June* 2022.

* June's start date will be a 3 month term.

This posting will close on Wednesday, January 19th, 2022 at 11:59PM EST. Applications will be reviewed and interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis. Applications will not be accepted after the deadline.

You’re the kind of person who has:

  • The desire to grow -- you'll have the opportunity to dive into new and uncomfortable challenges.

  • The ability to clearly present your point of view, express ideas, and accept feedback.

  • A passion for unpacking and solving complex problems.

  • A unique interest for the end user - advocating for them in all areas of your work is core to what you do.

  • A desire to improve on iterative design practices.

  • Proficiency with Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator or Figma. 

 Mandatory details for application below.

In your application:

1. Include your resume.

2. Project Submission: We’d like to see an example of your previous design work. This can be a project completed at school, at work, or as a personal project, anything that you were responsible for and that you can speak about confidently. Wrap up your project in Github or a public Google Drive link labelled Shopify-Summer2022-FirstName-LastName (using your name, of course!) and include it with your application. You may include things like pdf, HTML file without your name. Non-exported files e.g. Illustrator, XD, Sketch, Figma file will not be reviewed. (If you are new to the field or do not have a project to share, feel free to use this project idea to design a submission.)

3. Project Writeup: Please provide a maximum 1 page write-up about your project including the information below. Please include this separately. 

  • The problem: Tell us about the problem you’re solving. How did you learn more about the problem space? Were there constraints and what were they? 

  • Your process: What was your approach in solving the problem? If this was a group effort, what role did you play? Did your project go through multiple iterations? Tell us about it! 

  • Your solution: Describe your solution.  How would you validate that your solution solves the problem? 

  • Reflection: What was challenging about solving this problem? What did you learn while solving this problem? Is there anything in this project you’d like to get feedback on? If you had more time, or were doing this a second time, what would you do differently?

4. We're always looking to see where passion and engagement shows itself in all aspects of your life. Please answer the questions outlined in the application to tell us more about yourself!

  • If you were to open a Shopify store, what would you sell and why (or tell us about your store if you have one!) (200 word limit)

  • Any last thoughts? (ie. proud accomplishments, cool ideas, a joke, etc.) (200 word limit)

At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team, so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying!

 

The Hiring Process:

1. Candidates that move beyond the initial application stage will be invited to a “Life Story” interview with a Recruiter on the Intern Program team. 

2. After the Life Story, successful candidates will be invited to a 60 minute technical interview with two (2) Shopify Designers. You will be informed in advance of the interview of what you need to bring. 

3. After the technical interview, successful candidates are placed on teams based on their interests, skills and experience - each placement is done individually and with significant consideration.

Application screening will be on a rolling basis, with Life Stories happening throughout February, technical interviews throughout February and March, and final hiring decisions made by or before late March. 

Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.

This posting will close on Wednesday, January 19th 2022 at 11:59PM EST.

title: Assistant Store Manager
description:
Welkom bij JYSK! Wij verkopen alles om van een huis een thuis te maken: meubels, matrassen/dekbedden/kussens en woonaccessoires. Scandinavisch design aan betaalbare prijzen met een fantastische klantenservice als kers op de taart.

Samen met de Store Manager ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het beheer van een JYSK winkel. Met z’n tweeën bepalen jullie wat nodig is om de targets te behalen en motiveren jullie het team om deze doelen te realiseren.

Daarnaast:

  • Ben jij verantwoordelijk voor de sales resultaten en zorg jij dat elke klant kan proeven van een fantastische klantenservice.
  • Garandeer jij een optimale winkeluitstraling en logistiek proces.
  • Stel je een commerciële planning op in functie van de klant- en goederenstroom

Wij bieden (naast de gewone verloning):

  • Een bonus per kwartaal die een hoge omzet en goede resultaten beloont
  • Praktijkgerichte opleidingen die jou nog beter maken in jouw vak!
  • Doorgroeimogelijkheden (Wij streven ernaar om 90% van onze leidinggevenden intern te benoemen)

 

Uiteraard krijg je als ambassadeur van ons merk 20% korting op JYSK producten!

Deze functie is jou helemaal op het lijf geschreven want jij...:  

  • Hebt idealiter al ervaring opgedaan in een leidinggevende rol of bent klaar om deze stap te zetten
  • Houdt ervan om samen met je collega’s de krachten te bundelen en zo van elke dag een succes te maken. Je haalt het beste uit jouw collega’s naar boven en motiveert hen om de beste resultaten te behalen
  • Bent gedreven en ambitieus: een eigen JYSK winkel leiden binnen 1 à 2 jaar? Daar zeg jij geen nee tegen.
  • Weet van aanpakken: Je kan knopen doorhakken en richting aangeven, ook in stressvolle situaties
  •  Bent niet gemaakt voor een bureau job: als leidinggevende ben je aanwezig op de winkelvloer “where the magic happens”. Bovendien wordt je niet afgeschrikt door fysiek zwaar werk
  • Geniet graag van een vrije dag tijdens de week zodat je op zaterdag paraat kan staan voor jouw team en onze klanten.

Misschien heb je (nog) niet van ons gehoord, maar miljoenen klanten over de hele wereld wel. In 1979 openden we de allereerste JYSK winkel in Denemarken, sindsdien hebben we onze deuren in meer dan 50 landen geopend met als resultaat meer dan 3.000 winkels wereldwijd.

In april 2017 openden we de eerste winkels in België en we hebben de ambitie om tot 100 winkels te openen, met een tempo van 10 winkelopeningen per jaar. 

JYSK. Dat is:

  • Alles op alles zetten om de omzetdoelen te behalen en van zodra het zover is een vreugdedansje doen in het midden van de winkel
  • Zwetend en zwoegend 50 paletten vracht verwerken maar toch de goede vibe erin houden zodat we op het einde van de dag fier kunnen zijn op een super georganiseerd magazijn
  • Niet te trots zijn om als Store Manager de winkel te stofzuigen terwijl je team zich volledig op de verkoop heeft gestort
  • Harde inzet, drive en resultaten belonen met een volgende stap: als logistiek verantwoordelijke starten en terecht komen in een functie als District Manager? Als Verkoopmedewerker doorgroeien tot Retail Manager? Voorbeelden genoeg!

Kortom: bij JYSK proberen we dagelijks verwachtingen te overtreffen: van onze klanten, van onze collega’s en van onze kandidaten. AT JYSK WE PLAY TO WIN!

title: Senior Quest Designer
description:
To create revolutionary, story-driven RPGs which go straight to the hearts of gamers — this is our mission. As a driven team of talented professionals from all around the globe, we want to earn our place as one of the world’s top video-game developers, push narrative boundaries, and build unforgettable stories that set and redefine the standards for the genre.

The Quest Design team is growing and we're looking for people focused on narrative-driven and emotional design, with visual scripting knowledge and a knack for directing complex projects. As a part of the Quest Design team you will have an opportunity to design, implement and direct your own stories in our worlds!

Daily Responsibilities

  • Creating the storyline on a detailed level.
  • Designing quests and implementing them using a proprietary toolset.
  • Planning assets required for the creation of the quests.
  • Cooperating with other departments.
  • Integrating delivered assets (like gameplay elements, locations, characters, dialogue etc.) into a seamless, engaging and unique experience.
  • Maintaining the highest possible quality of quests, and fixing reported bugs.
  • Creating and maintaining design documentation.
  • At least 6 years of experience working in a Quest or Mission Design position, with at least 1 AAA shipped title with strong narrative design elements.
  • High creativity and excellent sense of narrative pacing.
  • Proven high proficiency with writing scenarios, screenplays or short stories.
  • Very high proficiency with visual scripting tools.
  • Experience with game editors and game design tools.
  • Strong critical thinking and analytical skills.
  • Sense for designing in-game features as well as tools for efficient implementation.
  • Ability to receive and apply feedback in a highly iterative environment.
  • Proven ability to effectively work across teams involved in a game development lifecycle.
  • Excellent communication skills & proven ability to work within a team.
  • Experience with mentoring other designers and ability to deliver accurate feedback.
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet production deadlines.
  • Real passion for playing games (cRPGs or pen&paper role playing systems).
  • Fluent English.

Nice to have:

(Please note that these skills are not required to apply for the position)

  • Credited work on narrative field for movies, plays or books.
  • Knowledge of Mike Pondsmith’s Cyberpunk and Andrzej Sapkowski's Witcher universes.
  • Familiarity with cyberpunk and dark fantasy genres in games, movies and literature.
  • Experience with narratives in multiplayer games.

Candidates for all Quest Design positions are kindly requested to provide portfolio/examples of the projects they did.


As a part of the recruitment process, a candidate for a Quest Designer is always asked to perform a test – design and implement quest with a specific number of requirements. Those are provided when the candidate decides to start a testing procedure and it has to be delivered on time in one of the following engines: RED kit, Skyrim Creation Kit, Aurora or Shadowrun.

  • A modern and relaxed studio atmosphere.
  • A chance to work in a booming industry, within an international team.
  • 24/7 gym for CDPR employees with personal trainer on-site.
  • Private health care & Multisport card.
  • 2 canteens, fully equipped kitchens, fresh fruit every week for everyone in the office, a wide choice of tea, fancy coffee machines and several types of milk :)
  • Free library with a wide range of games and books.
  • Many social activities and parties.
  • A dog-friendly office.
  • From 20 to 26 days of paid vacation per year.
  • Step by step assistance and a ‘Relocation Package’ for new staff willing to relocate to Poland.
  • Polish lessons for foreign employees.

title: Agent de Collecte Chauffeur SPL H/F
description:
Akiolis, un groupe au cœur du développement durable

Akiolis produit des graisses et des protéines animales à destination de l'alimentation des animaux de compagnie et des poissons d’élevage, mais également des industries de la gélatine, des corps gras, de la fabrication d’engrais organiques ou de la production d’énergies vertes.

Akiolis est un acteur de l’économie circulaire. Les enjeux de société tels que la lutte contre le gaspillage, l’alimentation saine, le respect de la planète, la protection de l’environnement et de la santé animale sont au cœur de son activité.

Tous les collaborateurs d’Akiolis tirent une grande fierté de cette contribution vertueuse à l’amélioration de nos modes de consommation.

Ainsi, présent partout en France au travers de ses 12 usines et de ses 48 Centres de collectes, Akiolis valorise les matières animales non consommées par l’homme générées tout au long du cycle de production des viandes et assure un rôle de sécurisation sanitaire de la chaîne alimentaire et de protection de l’environnement;

Poste basé à Javené (35) SOLEVAL France

Dans le respect de la réglementation, des contrats et des normes d’hygiène en vigueur au sein de l’entreprise vous garantissez la collecte des matières et des données administratives dont vous avez la charge (abattoirs) et vous assurez l’approvisionnement de l’usine dans le respect du plan de collecte et conformément au cadre réglementaire, législatif et environnemental.
A cet effet vous :

  • Vérifiez l'état de fonctionnement du véhicule et des équipements,
  • Réalisez l'enlèvement, l'acheminement et le déchargement des matières
  • Contrôlez la conformité et la qualité des matières/produits collectés et des données administratives
  • Maintenez le bon état et la propreté du véhicule
  • Conduisez de manière économique dans le respect du code de la route

Permis CE + FIMO/FCO Marchandises + Carte chrono-numérique en cours de validité exigés. Le CACES Grue Auxiliaire avec option télécommande est un plus. 3 à 5 ans d’expérience de conduite SPL . Pas de découché - Horaire journée

Vous êtes Ponctuel(le), sérieux(se), rigoureux(se) et courtois(e). Vous avez le Sens du service. Vous maîtrisez des systèmes d’aide à la conduite. Vous manœuvrez votre véhicule avec agilité et précision tout en respectant les codes, règles et normes.
Vous savez effectuer des dépannages de 1er niveau. Vous avez l'aptitude à conseiller pour améliorer la qualité du tri.
